position.marginalia_text: Pra[e]stat plus facere, quàm plus sapere.

marginalia.translation: It is superior to do more than to know more.

position.marginalia_text: / agat; vt ipse / quondam Ca[e]sar: singula / expeditissimè omnium: et / tamen omnia absolutiss[im]è / singulorum.

marginalia.translation: Axiophilus reads, writes, and does (just as Caesar himself once did) the singular of all things in a most expedient manner, yet all singular things in a most complete manner.

position.marginalia_text: { Qui vix est suus, a[e]grè fit alterius.

marginalia.translation: He who is hardly his own, with difficulty becomes another's.

position.marginalia_text: { Undè prima cura, { Teipsum expedire promptissimè.

marginalia.translation: Whence, your first concern is to set yourself free most readily.

position.marginalia_text: { Quod opus no[n] est, asse carum est.

X-ref.text: Quod opus non est, asse carum est.

marginalia.translation: "What you do not want is dear at a farthing."

position.marginalia_text: Hodiè vincit, non I,U,S, sed V,I,S.

marginalia.translation: Today, not JUSTICE but FORCE is the victor.

position.marginalia_text: gli huomini singolari di Francesco Guicciardini; prontissimi d'ingegno; e efficaci molto nelle Parole. Massimamente, Alessandro VI e suo figliuolo, Cesare Borgia; lo Specchio de tutti astutissimi, et valorosissimi Politici del mondo. Giulio 2. Lorenzo de' Medici. Consaluo, gran Capitano. Lodouico Sforza, duca di Milano. D'Aualos, Marchese di Pescara. tutti efficacissimi nel parlare, et negociare. Egregij Pramatici.

marginalia.translation: The singular men of Francesco Guicciardini, most ready in genius and most effective in words. Especially Alexander VI and his son Cesare Borgia, the mirror of all the most astute and most valorous political men in the world. Julius the 2nd. Lorenzo de' Medici. Consalvo, a great captain. Lodovico Sforza, duke of Milan. D'Avalos, marquis of Pescara. All most effective in speaking and doing business. Outstanding practical men.

position.marginalia_text: Qui plus sapit, et minus facit, eius sapientia firma non est: Qui minus sapit, et plus facit, eius sapientia firma est. Vt prudenter Hanna, in apophthegmatis Hebra[e]orum Sapientum.

marginalia.translation: He who knows more but does less, does not possess solid wisdom. Who knows less and does more possesses solid wisdom, like prudent Hanna in the aphorisms of the Jewish wisemen.

position.marginalia_text: Statim ad rem ipsam: sine vllis parergis. Solus procedendi modus solidus.

marginalia.translation: Immediately to the thing itself, without any ornamentation. Only a solid way of proceding.

symbol.name: SS
symbol.text: Far mestieri d'esser lento al deliberare, e veloce ad esequire.

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: Far mestieri d'esser lento al deliberare, e veloce ad esequire
